overview: Healthy Start is a voucher scheme for women who have young children or who are pregnant and receiving benefits  - what you'll get, eligibility and applying
title: Healthy Start

table.body:
If you're pregnant or have a small child, the [Healthy Start](http://www.healthystart.nhs.uk/ "Healthy Start"){:rel="external"} scheme can help you and your children stay healthy. If you're eligible you can get vouchers to buy basic foods, such as milk and fruit. 

You can also get coupons to swap for free vitamins suitable for:

- pregnant women
- breastfeeding women
- growing children
table.title: Overview

table.body:
If you qualify, you'll get vouchers worth £3.10 each to spend on:

- milk
- fresh fruit
- vegetables
- infant formula

You get 1 voucher a week if you:

- are a pregnant woman
- have a 2 or 3 year old child

You get 2 vouchers a week if you have a:

- child under 1

You can also get free vitamin supplements.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
[Check your eligibility.](http://www.healthystart.nhs.uk/healthy-start-vouchers/do-i-qualify/ "Check your eligibility"){:rel="external"}

You may qualify for the Healthy Start scheme if:

- you’re pregnant
- you have at least 1 child under 4 

In addition, you also need to be receiving any of the following:

- Income Support
- income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance
- Child Tax Credit
- Income-related Employment and Support Allowance

If you're pregnant and under 18 you may also be eligible for the Healthy Start scheme.

You may also qualify if you're receiving Working Tax credit run-on and have an annual family income of £16,190 or less (for 2011/2012). 

^Working Tax credit run-on is the payment you receive for a further 4 weeks immediately after you stop qualifying for Working Tax Credit.^
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
[Apply for Healthy Start vouchers](http://www.healthystart.nhs.uk/healthy-start-vouchers/how-to-apply/online-application-form/ "Apply for Healthy Start vouchers"){:rel="external"} by filling in the online form and printing it out. 

You'll need to get your midwife, health visitor or registered doctor or nurse to sign it before returning it to:

$A
Freepost RRTR-SYAE-JKCR
Healthy Start Issuing Unit
PO Box 1067
Warrington
WA55 1EG
$A

Or you can download the form directly from the website:

$D
[Download a Healthy Start application form (PDF, 86KB)](http://www.healthystart.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/Healthy-Start_applicationform.pdf "PDF, 86KB")
$D

You can also get an application form from:

- your midwife
- your local GP surgery

Or by phoning the Healthy Start helpline:

$C**Telephone:** 0845 607 6823$C
table.title: How to claim
